message_1: A group of 7 students have to form a committee of 4 students. In how many ways can the committee be formed?
message_2:
To form a committee of 4 students from a group of 7 students, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of students (7 in this case) and k is the number of students to be selected for the committee (4 in this case).

C(7, 4) = 7! / (4!(7-4)!)

C(7, 4) = 7! / (4!3!)

C(7, 4) = (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((4 × 3 × 2 × 1)(3 × 2 × 1))

C(7, 4) = (7 × 6 × 5) / (4 × 3 × 2 × 1)

C(7, 4) = 210

So, there are 210 ways to form a committee of 4 students from a group of 7 students.
